repnme.cdata!:
Trinidad and Tobago - Technical Assistance
            Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Technical Assistance Project in
            Trinidad and Tobago. The Government did not have in place
            sufficient institutional capacity to ensure effectived esign
            and implementationo f the overalla djustmentp rogramo r to
            design andprepare the necessary social programs. The $4.0
            million Technical Assistance Loan (TAL) that accompaniedt he
            SAL,t herefore,f inancedc onsultants ervicesa nd some
            equipment to help the Government: (i) implement its
            medium-term adjustment program; (ii) strengthen social
            sector policies and programs, including the design and
            preparation of programs to cushion the impact of adjustment;
            and (iii) prepare possible future Bank operations. The SAL
            and the TAL were approved. Some of the key lessons include:
            Appointment of skilled project managers with adequately
            staffed project implementation units and access to decision
            makers is essential for the success of SAL/TAL type
            operations. Management of large amounts of TA can be
            burdensome for borrowers, particularly borrowers lacking
            experience in managing large numbers of consultants. The
            Bank should offer training for borrowers (perhaps through
            the EDI) in the Management of TA. This would
            enhancepossibilities of maximizing the "transfer of
            technology". In countries where project evaluation is
            weak, consideration should be given to covenanting in loan
            agreements the Bank's and borrower'sobligation to
            prepare ICRs. Funding should be included to assist the
            borrower in initiating such an evaluation prior to the
            Bank!s final review mission.

repnme.cdata!: Trinidad and Tobago - Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Technical Assistance Loan Project
            will help the Government: (a) implement its medium-term
            adjustment program; (b) strengthen social sector policies
            and programs; and (c) prepare possible future Bank
            operations. The project will support the establishment of a
            Restructuring Support Unit (RSU) and a Social Sectors Unit
            (SSU) in the Ministry of Planning and Mobilization. For each
            unit, the loan will finance consultants to work with local
            Government staff. The RSU will focus on implementing the
            reforms supported by the Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL) as
            well as other aspects of the Government's adjustment
            program and on the preparatory work for further reforms. On
            the other hand, the SSU will focus on strengthening social
            sector policies and programs, including the design and
            preparation of programs to cushion the social costs of adjustment.
